channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Woman shot by husband wants gun law change
item.description: Rachel Williams, whose estranged husband shot her in 2011, says guns should not be kept at home.

item.title: Sepsis: Teen footballer wants better care for young adults
item.description: Hollie Smith, 19, dreamed of playing for Wales - but after sepsis she needs round-the-clock care.

item.title: Burry Port: Fear for children after asbestos found on beach
item.description: Campaigners are calling for the removal of what they say is hazardous waste uncovered by erosion.

item.title: Clydach murders: Killer David Morris dies in prison
item.description: David Morris was serving a 32-year sentence for killing three generations of the same family.

item.title: Llandudno: Dog rescued after falling from cliff
item.description: Five RNLI staff had to help to rescue Tug, a Cocker Spaniel, who became was stuck among rocks.

item.title: Monmouthshire and Brecon Canal boaters asked to share stories
item.description: A tradition dating back three decades of writing about adventures on the water has been restarted.

item.title: Message in a bottle washes up after 3,000-mile journey
item.description: Amanda Tidmarsh found the message, from near Canada, while walking her dogs in south Wales.

item.title: Newport County boss Flynn tests positive for Covid
item.description: Newport County manager Michael Flynn will miss their next three games after testing positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Weather: Warning for heavy rain in Wales
item.description: The Met Office says there is a good chance areas will see travel disruption.

item.title: Hospitals: Study to look at benefits of outdoor treatment
item.description: Researchers will explore the benefits of outdoor treatment spaces at two hospitals.

item.title: Boardmasters: More than 50 Covid cases in Swansea Bay linked to festival
item.description: At least 56 cases in a single health board are confirmed in people who attended the event.

item.title: Covid infections in Wales estimated to be rising
item.description: The latest Covid infection estimates point to a rise in Wales but not the other UK nations.

item.title: Green Man: Festival returns in the Welsh mountains after Covid restrictions
item.description: Wales' largest music festival, Green Man, returns with 25,000 people in attendance.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Gun survivor calls for change to firearms laws
item.description: A woman who survived being shot in 2011 wants tougher gun laws following the Plymouth shooting.

item.title: Syrian family in Cardigan advise Afghan refugees about Wales
item.description: The Alchikhs made Cardigan their home after spending three years in a Lebanese refugee camp.

item.title: Covid: 'I watched my father, 85, die gasping for breath'
item.description: A woman, whose dad died with Covid after going to hospital with an infection, calls for answers.

item.title: Wrexham: Hollywood-style sign mystery solved
item.description: Many thought Wrexham AFC's new owners, Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney, were behind the stunt.

item.title: Wrexham: Call for funding to repair landslip-hit road
item.description: A road swept away by Storm Christoph six months ago may remain closed for years, an MS warns.

item.title: Cardiff City 3-1 Millwall: Centre-back Aden Flint scores twice for Bluebirds
item.description: Aden Flint scores two goals in four second-half minutes to extend Cardiff City's unbeaten start to the season with a 3-1 victory over Millwall.

item.title: Tranmere Rovers 0-1 Newport County: Alex Fisher gives Exiles winning edge
item.description: Striker Alex Fisher marks his first start for Newport County with the winning goal away to Tranmere Rovers.

item.title: Solihull 2-2 Wrexham: Drama as Joe Sbarra denies Wrexham late on
item.description: Wrexham start their first full season under Hollywood owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney with a dramatic 2-2 draw at Solihull Moors.

item.title: Sean Fitzpatrick: Wales must boost regional game to challenge top sides, says All Blacks great
item.description: New Zealand great Sean Fitzpatrick says Wales must build from the bottom up if the national team is ever to taste victory over the All Blacks again.

item.title: Russell Martin: Head coach confirms Swansea City in talks with transfer targets
item.description: Swansea City head coach Russell Martin is confident he can add to his squad before the transfer window shuts on 31 August.

item.title: Galw am symud gwastraff asbestos o draeth Porth Tywyn
item.description: Ymgyrchwyr yn ofni am niwed posib, ond y cyngor yn dweud eu bod yn cymryd camau er risg "isel".

item.title: Achub ci oedd yn gaeth ar ôl syrthio o glogwyn
item.description: Bu'n rhaid i bum aelod o griw'r RNLI helpu achub cocker spaniel oedd yn gaeth rhwng creigiau.

item.title: Rhybudd stormydd i rannau o Gymru ddydd Sadwrn
item.description: Siroedd y dwyrain sy'n fwyaf tebygol o gael eu heffeithio wrth i rybudd melyn ddod i rym am 12:00.

item.title: Pum munud gyda'r awdur a'r cyflwynydd Mike Parker
item.description: Pum munud yng nghwmni enillydd gwobr Owain Glyndŵr yng Ngŵyl Machynlleth eleni Mike Parker.

item.title: Y Bencampwriaeth: Caerdydd 3-1 Millwall
item.description: Record ddiguro Caerdydd yn parhau wrth i Aden Flint sgorio ddwywaith am yr eildro mewn wythnos.
